body_html:
My guess is CUDA 10 will be later Q3 or early Q4. I can see moving to CUDA 9.2 near the end of the cycle in early Q3. That makes the move to Ubuntu 18.04 not really relevant, and I still think it may be a good time to move to 18.04 as that keeps us in the middle of the cycles 16.04 end of life's April 2021.

How many systems to you manage and are you upgrading them all to Ubuntu 18.04? That seems aggressive for a production system. I am going to mark this closed as we will not be accepting the change in the near-term.

body:
My guess is CUDA 10 will be later Q3 or early Q4.  I can see moving to CUDA 9.2 near the end of the cycle in early Q3.  That makes the move to Ubuntu 18.04 not really relevant, and I still think it may be a good time to move to 18.04 as that keeps us in the middle of the cycles  16.04 end of life's April 2021.  

How many systems to you manage and are you upgrading them all to Ubuntu 18.04?  That seems aggressive for a production system.  I am going to mark this closed as we will not be accepting the change in the near-term.
